name: MP Materials
description: 15% stake for $400 million from the Department of Defense, making it the company's largest shareholder. Guaranteed offtake agreements and price floor agreement included.
structure: Guaranteed price of $110/kg for 10 years (current market: ~$60/kg), with 30% profit sharing above $110. DoD commits to purchasing all NdFEB magnets for 10 years at cost plus $140M annually. 15% equity stake through convertible stock and warrants. $150M loan to expand the Mountain Pass processing facility.
area: Critical Minerals, Rare Earths, Neodymium, Praseodymium

name: Intel
structure: $5.7 billion from remaining CHIPS Act grants plus $3.2 billion from Secure Enclave program

name: US Steel / Nippon Steel
description: 'Golden share' giving the federal government veto power over key corporate decisions as part of the Nippon Steel acquisition approval

name: Lithium Americas Corporation
description: 5% stake in the company plus a separate 5% stake in the Thacker Pass joint venture with General Motors, as part of restructuring a $2.26 billion loan
structure: $182 million in deferred debt payments over 5 years in exchange for 5% equity stake in Lithium Americas and additional 5% stake in Thacker Pass JV with GM

notes.text: Third highest official at the Department of Interior has direct conflict of interest from family investments in water rights near Thacker Pass.

name: Trilogy Metals Inc.
description: 10% stake for $35.6 million investment, plus warrants for an additional 7.5%

name: Vulcan Elements / ReElement Technologies
description: $50 million equity stake from the Department of Commerce as part of a $1.4 billion partnership; the Department of Defense also received warrants

name: Korea Zinc
description: $1.9B of shares sold to a joint venture with 40% Department of Defense ownership and 60% unnamed investors yielding a 10% total stake in Korea Zinc

name: Atlantic Alumina
description: $150M of preferred equity in ATALCO by the Department of Defense's Industrial Base Analysis and Sustainment program. Pinnacle Asset Management and Concord Resources to provide $300M in private capital.
structure: $150M of preferred equity, with additional government funding expected.

name: Westinghouse
description: The U.S. government gets 20% of Westinghouse profits above $17.5 billion, plus the option to require an IPO and purchase a 20% equity stake if the company is valued at $30 billion or more by January 2029.
